ReuseThreadingServer(server_address, RequestHandlerClass, bind_and_activate=True) :: ThreadingTCPServer

run_server[source]

run_server(hostname:"Host name or IP"='localhost', port:"Port to listen on"=8000, debug:"If True, do not trigger actions, just print"=False, inifile:"Path to settings ini file"='twitter.ini', check_ip:"Check source IP against GitHub list"=True, single_request:"Handle one request"=False)

Run a GitHub webhook server that tweets about new releases

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
time.sleep(0.5) # wait for previous server to stop
threaded(partial(run_server, check_ip=False, debug=True, single_request=True))();

Listening on ('localhost', 8000)
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
time.sleep(0.5)
urlread("http://localhost:8000", spam=1)

Accept-Encoding: identity
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Content-Length: 6
Host: localhost:8000
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.183 Safari/537.36
Connection: close

 b'spam=1'

b''

Installer

{% raw %}

fastwebhook_install_service[source]

fastwebhook_install_service(hostname:"Host name or IP"='0.0.0.0', port:"Port to listen on"=8000, inifile:"Path to settings ini file"='twitter.ini', check_ip:"Check source IP against GitHub list"=True, service_path:"Directory to write service file to"='/etc/systemd/system/')

Install fastwebhook as a service

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

This fastcore.script CLI installs fastwebhook as a systemd service. Run fastwebhook_install_service --help in your terminal for options.
